task.title: Task: Total Row
task.shortdesc: How to add a total row.

context.p: You can summarize numeric data in a table with a subtotal that appears at the bottom of the table. Although the word subtotal implies that you are summing the numeric values in a column, Excel uses the term more broadly. That is, a subtotal can be not only a numeric sum, but also an average, a maximum or minimum, a standard deviation or a variance, or a count of the values in the field. The calculation is based on the visible cells in the table's column.

step.cmd: Convert the data range to a table.
Choose Design (Table Tools) Check Total Row (group Table Style Options)

stepresult.p: A row Total is inserted at the bottom of the table and a SUBTOTAL function is added below the last column. In this case, the function is meaningless because the last column is a date column.

step.cmd: Select in the total row the cell below column Start date, the selector and choose None.
Select in the total row the cell below column Salary, the selector and choose Sum.
